title: E2E: review existing tests against enterprise strategy, document
description:
attached_molecule: so-wisp-5dt
attached_at: 2026-02-15T05:46:09Z
dispatched_by: mayor

Enterprise E2E strategy (enterprise-arch/e2e-testing-strategy.md) confirms SolIntegration E2E tests are the reference implementation. Action items:

1. Review existing E2E tests against enterprise-defined scenarios: SOL balance fetch (P0), empty wallet handling (P0), invalid address (P0), SPL token fetch (P1), full portfolio snapshot (P1), NFT detection (P1), RPC failover (P1), connection health (P1), cache invalidation (P2), concurrent requests (P2)
2. Add any missing P0/P1 scenarios
3. Verify vitest.e2e.config.ts matches enterprise standard (60s timeout, sequential, 2 retries, verbose)
4. Standardize npm script: test:e2e
5. Document E2E strategy in repo ARCHITECTURE.md — which scenarios apply, infrastructure setup, how to run locally, test wallets, devnet considerations
6. All tests must pass: npm run build && npm test && npm run test:e2e

title: Add Solana DeFi protocol adapters: Marinade, Raydium, Jupiter, Orca
description:
attached_molecule: so-wisp-8f2
attached_at: 2026-02-17T22:58:52Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Add Solana DeFi protocol adapters following the same pattern as evm-integration's ev-82k. Create src/defi/ submodule with: (1) Marinade adapter — read mSOL stake accounts and exchange rate, (2) Raydium adapter — read LP pool state and user positions, (3) Jupiter adapter — DCA/limit order/perp positions, (4) Orca adapter — Whirlpool concentrated liquidity positions. Add DeFiService facade and IDeFiProtocol interface. Return DeFiPosition types from @cygnus-wealth/data-models. Expose getDeFiPositions(addresses) method. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode. Do NOT run E2E tests locally — only build + unit tests.
dispatched_by: mayor

Wave 4: Add DeFi protocol adapters to sol-integration following the same pattern as ev-82k in evm-integration.

Protocols to support:
- Marinade Finance — liquid staking (mSOL). Read stake account state, mSOL/SOL exchange rate.
- Raydium — LP position tracking. Read pool state, user LP token balances, underlying token amounts.
- Jupiter — DCA positions, limit orders, perps positions. Query Jupiter program accounts.
- Orca — concentrated liquidity (Whirlpools). Read position NFTs, tick ranges, liquidity amounts.

Structure: Create src/defi/ submodule with adapter registry, individual protocol adapters, and a DeFiService facade. Expose getDeFiPositions(addresses) method. Return DeFiPosition types from @cygnus-wealth/data-models.

Follow the same TDD pattern as ev-82k. Reference evm-integration's DeFi implementation for structural guidance.

title: Phase 5: Wire sol-integration to use RPC fallback chain
description:
attached_molecule: so-wisp-a33
attached_at: 2026-02-18T00:08:54Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Phase 5 of RPC fallback chain (per en-25w5). Wire sol-integration to use RPC fallback infrastructure. Import or duplicate CircuitBreaker, RpcFallbackChain, TokenBucketRateLimiter, HealthMonitor from @cygnus-wealth/evm-integration (or re-implement if import not feasible). Add createSolIntegration(config: RpcProviderConfig) factory. Create per-endpoint @solana/web3.js Connection instances. Route ALL RPC calls through RpcFallbackChain. DAS-aware fallback: Helius DAS API methods have restricted fallback path. Health check using getHealth(). REMOVE all references to api.mainnet-beta.solana.com as primary. Use RpcProviderConfig types from @cygnus-wealth/data-models. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode. Do NOT run E2E tests locally.
dispatched_by: mayor

RPC fallback chain Phase 5 (per en-25w5 directive). Depends on Phase 3 (RPC infrastructure).

Wire sol-integration to use the fallback chain:
- Add createSolIntegration(config: RpcProviderConfig) factory function
- Create per-endpoint @solana/web3.js Connection instances
- Route ALL RPC calls through RpcFallbackChain
- DAS-aware fallback: methods requiring Helius DAS API have restricted fallback path
- Helius-specific health check using getHealth()
- REMOVE all references to api.mainnet-beta.solana.com as primary endpoint
- Import or duplicate RPC infrastructure from Phase 3
Follow TDD.

title: Solana WebSocket subscription service — accountSubscribe, programSubscribe, fallback
description:
attached_molecule: so-wisp-0c4
attached_at: 2026-02-18T07:24:58Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Solana WebSocket subscription service per en-p0ha architecture directive (step 6). accountSubscribe for SOL balances, accountSubscribe for SPL token accounts, programSubscribe for DeFi positions, slotSubscribe for slot updates, signatureSubscribe for tx status. WS connection management with lazy establishment, reconnection, heartbeat. Primary: Helius. Secondary: Alchemy. Debounce slot events to 2s windows. Polling fallback on WS failure. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode.
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement Solana WebSocket subscription service per en-p0ha architecture directive (step 6).

Add SubscriptionService to sol-integration using Solana-native WS methods:
- accountSubscribe(pubkey, {commitment: 'confirmed'}) for SOL balance changes (one per tracked wallet)
- accountSubscribe(tokenAccountPubkey, {commitment: 'confirmed'}) for SPL token changes (one per tracked ATA)
- programSubscribe(programId, {filters, commitment: 'confirmed'}) for DeFi position tracking
- slotSubscribe() for slot updates (equivalent of new blocks)
- signatureSubscribe(signature, {commitment: 'confirmed'}) for transaction status

WS connection management: same pattern as EVM — lazy establishment, exponential backoff reconnection, heartbeat, subscription registry. Primary: Helius wss://mainnet.helius-rpc.com/?api-key={apiKey}. Secondary: Alchemy. Tertiary: public wss://api.mainnet-beta.solana.com (rate-limited, avoid for subscriptions).

Helius supports 40K concurrent subscriptions per connection — individual accountSubscribe per address is fine.

Solana-specific: debounce slot events to 2-second windows (0.4s slots produce too many events). Use application-level ping (getHealth) for heartbeat since Solana WS may not support native ping/pong.

Polling fallback: same pattern as EVM — fall back to 30s HTTP polling when WS fails, attempt WS recovery every 60s.

Export same SubscriptionService interface shape as EVM: subscribeAccountChanges, subscribeTokenAccounts, subscribeProgramChanges, subscribeSlotChanges, subscribeSignatureStatus, unsubscribe, getSubscriptionStatus.

Emit same domain events as EVM (WEBSOCKET_CONNECTED, etc.).

Follow TDD. Reference: enterprise-arch mayor/en-p0ha-websocket-first-architecture.md

title: Fix failing WebSocket endpoint failover test
description:
attached_molecule: so-wisp-d1xl
attached_at: 2026-02-18T18:23:27Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. NEVER use EnterPlanMode. START CODING IMMEDIATELY. Fix the failing test in PR #5 branch polecat/rust/so-j7ly@mlrphvqo. The test 'WebSocketManager > reconnect > should try next endpoint after multiple failures' at src/test/infrastructure/WebSocketManager.test.ts:268 expects endpoint name 'alchemy' but gets 'public'. Either the failover rotation logic is wrong or the test expectation is wrong. Check the WebSocketManager reconnect/failover implementation and fix whichever side is incorrect. 351/352 tests currently pass. Make all 352 pass. Do NOT run E2E tests locally — only build + unit tests.
dispatched_by: mayor

PR #5 (Solana WebSocket subscription service) has 1 failing test in CI: WebSocketManager > reconnect > should try next endpoint after multiple failures. Test expects endpoint name 'alchemy' but gets 'public'. The endpoint rotation order is wrong — likely a race condition or incorrect failover sequence in the reconnect logic. Fix the test or the implementation so CI passes. 351/352 tests pass, just this one is broken.
